â€œI started to draw people of color in my artwork because I wanted to show the diversity and the nuances within our society,â€ says French illustrator and animator AurÃ©lia Durand (@4ur3lia), whose mother is from the Ivory Coast and father is from France.â£

â€œGrowing up in a multicultural environment has made my vision of the world plural. I donâ€™t see one kind of person, but many stories â€” and they are worthy to share. My goal as an artist engaged in the anti-racist movement is to draw joyful moments to spread good vibes.â€ #ShareBlackStoriesâ£
